# GCControllerDirectionPad

**Class**

A control element associated with a directional pad or a thumbstick.

## Declaration

```swift
class GCControllerDirectionPad
```

## Overview

You get the input values for this element from its subelements. You can use either the [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCControllerDirectionPad/xAxis] and [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCControllerDirectionPad/yAxis] properties to get coordinates, or the [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCControllerDirectionPad/up], [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCControllerDirectionPad/down], [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCControllerDirectionPad/left], and [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/GCControllerDirectionPad/right] buttons that simulate directional pad buttons.

## Accessing values using the axes

- **xAxis**: The x-axis element of the directional pad.
- **yAxis**: The y-axis element of the directional pad.

## Accessing values using directional buttons

- **right**: The button element that changes the positive x-axis.
- **left**: The button element that changes the negative x-axis.
- **up**: The button element that changes the positive y-axis.
- **down**: The button element used for the negative y-axis direction.

## Getting change information

- **valueChangedHandler**: The block that the directional pad calls when the user changes its values.
- **GCControllerDirectionPadValueChangedHandler**: The signature for the block that executes when either axis changes values.

## Setting snapshot values

- **setValueForXAxis(_:yAxis:)**: Sets the input values of a snapshot of a directional pad.

## Accessing controller elements

- **GCControllerElement**: An input for a physical control, such as a button or thumbstick.
- **GCControllerAxisInput**: A control element that tracks movement along an axis.
- **GCControllerButtonInput**: A control element that represents a button touch or press.
- **GCControllerTouchpad**: A control element that represents a touch event on a touchpad.
- **GCDeviceCursor**: A control element for the cursor used as a directional pad.
- **GCDualSenseAdaptiveTrigger**: A class that encapsulates the features of a DualSense adaptive trigger.

## Inherits From

- GCControllerElement

## Inherited By

- GCDeviceCursor
